title: 108_hr3023
content: The Act may be cited as the "Gasoline Availability Stabilization (GAS) Reserves Act" and establishes the Gasoline Availability Stabilization Reserve. The Secretary will establish a Gasoline Availability Stabilization Reserve (GAS Reserve) with a capacity of 20,000,000 barrels of regular unleaded gasoline at various sites in the Northeast, Midwest, and California. The Secretary must also ensure Homeland Security's approval for the physical design of the reserve. The Secretary of Homeland Security will establish a Gasoline Availability Stabilization Reserve (GAS Reserve) with 20,000,000 barrels of gasoline. A transportation plan must be submitted within 2 years, and filling the reserve should be completed by March 1, 2006. Emergency sales of gasoline from the reserve can be authorized in case of a physical disruption in the system. The Secretary of Homeland Security will establish a Gasoline Availability Stabilization Reserve (GAS Reserve) with 20,000,000 barrels of gasoline. Emergency sales from the reserve can be authorized in case of a physical disruption in the system supplying gasoline to the Governor's State, leading to price volatility in retail gasoline markets. The Secretary must ensure that such sales would mitigate price volatility without harming the long-term economic viability of the markets. The Secretary of Homeland Security will establish a Gasoline Availability Stabilization Reserve (GAS Reserve) with 20,000,000 barrels of gasoline. Emergency sales from the reserve can be authorized in case of economic disruption in the Governor's State and adjacent States. The Secretary must respond to requests within 10 days and provide a written notice of approval with a description of the GAS Reserve emergency sale plan. The Secretary can conduct purchases and sales of gasoline at wholesale for maintenance purposes. If the Governor's request for additional information is not responded to within 10 days, it will be denied. The Secretary must approve or deny requests within 10 days after receiving all requested information. The Secretary can conduct wholesale purchases and sales of gasoline for GAS Reserve maintenance, ensuring availability during peak demand, maintaining quality, and minimizing impact on retail prices. Annual reports on the program's status are required to be submitted to relevant committees by November 1 each year. The Secretary can conduct wholesale purchases and sales of gasoline for GAS Reserve maintenance to ensure availability during peak demand and minimize impact on retail prices. Authorization of appropriations is provided for the construction and operation of the GAS Reserve for fiscal years 2004 through 2009.
